channel.title: Microsoft are trolls? xbox one
channel.description:
Microsoft said on Wednesday that users of its forthcoming Xbox One game console will be able to play games offline without establishing an Internet connection, and [b]will be able[/b] to lend or sell used disc-based games.
http://uk.reuters.com/article/2013/06/19/us-microsoft-xbox-idUKBRE95I1MV20130619

item.title: Microsoft are trolls? xbox one
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:17, topic:522626”]The problem with them removing the always online DRM was that it also removes a lot of cool features that came with it. Like: Being able to log in on any xbox and have all of your games with you, no need for the disc (anyone ever scratch/break a disc?), ability to share your library with up to 10 “family” members.

Steam has been doing this forever; you purchase a license to play the game, you don’t buy an actual copy of the game. (If you read the Mojang EULA you agree to the same thing for all of their games too fyi) Almost everyone that digitally sells games makes you agree to purchasing a license. The only people complaining are the people who bitch just because they can. Microsoft removed the DRM and the same group of people are now bitching at them for doing a complete 180.

In all honesty, I hope they let you opt-in for all of these features at the price of having to always be online.[/quote]
You will always have people who complain no matter what happens.

I feel the Xbox One is making the Xbox Franchise. I know many people that are switching to the PlayStation 4 from the Xbox.

The exclusives and price point. I’m more switching to PC gaming but I prefer the Playstation’s exclusives over the Xbox’s and I’m not that much of a gamer to pay for XBL’s price either.

[/quote]

Oh my bad. Yes then I guess they have a contract with Activision.
